name: Fashion Industry Overview
overview: The fashion industry encompasses the design, production, marketing, and retail of clothing and accessories. It is one of the most dynamic and globally integrated industries, with a supply chain that connects raw material sourcing, textile manufacturing, garment production, and consumer distribution. Sustainability in fashion requires attention to every stage — from fibre sourcing and dyeing to packaging and post-consumer waste.
factors_for_sustainability: Material sourcing and transparency — preference for organic, recycled, or certified fibres (e.g., GOTS, OEKO-TEX).
Fair labour and ethical manufacturing — ensuring safe conditions, fair pay, and no forced or child labour.
Water and chemical management — reducing dye runoff, wastewater, and toxic chemical use.
Waste reduction and circular design — designing for durability, repairability, and recycling.
Carbon and energy impact — using renewable energy and efficient transport in supply chains.
Packaging and logistics — minimising plastics and using biodegradable or recycled materials.
sdgs: SDG 8 – Decent Work and Economic Growth
concerns: High textile waste and landfill contributions.
Fast fashion overproduction and short product lifecycles.
Lack of traceability in complex supply chains.
Limited recycling infrastructure for post-consumer textiles.
